Same problem with Axis2 skeleton.

Reason behind this is WS-I BaseProfile 1.0 bans RPC-Encoded, and Axis2 doesn't support it.

Some resources 

http://ws.apache.org/axis2/1_2/Axis2-rpc-support.html
http://wso2.org/library/91


Thanks 

Lahiru

I went to the Axis2 site mentioned but did not get a clear indication that RPC encoded is not supported.  It's describing how Axis2 is handling converting RPC style WSDL into Doc/lit style.  So is this an Axis2 problem that it's throwing an exception in the WSDL11ToAxisServiceBuilder.populateService() when handling a WSDL file with RPC/encoded?
*** Bug 193408 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

(In reply to comment #2)
> I went to the Axis2 site mentioned but did not get a clear indication that RPC
> encoded is not supported.  It's describing how Axis2 is handling converting RPC
> style WSDL into Doc/lit style.  So is this an Axis2 problem that it's throwing
> an exception in the WSDL11ToAxisServiceBuilder.populateService() when handling
> a WSDL file with RPC/encoded?

You maybe went to the Axis2 RPC support page located at http://ws.apache.org/axis2/1_2/Axis2-rpc-support.html, so that its interprits as "Note that Axis2 currently does not support the rpc/encoded style fully. Its main support is for the rpc/lit style.", We have the issue on the code generation so its clear that "Since the Axis2 code generator is based on pure doc/lit style", So its talks about the conversion. So then comes the problem that the Databinding support to the RPC style underling the code codegeneration. So catually the code can be generated from the code generation, but the support of the databing will be limited, AFAIK. 
I ll follow up this with the Axis2 Devs.

Thanks 

Lahiru
